meanings.definition: To reason earnestly with someone in an effort to dissuade or correct them.
meanings.sent1: She expostulates with her friend about the dangers of smoking.
meanings.sent2: He expostulates with the teacher about the unfair grading system.
meanings.sent3: The cat expostulates with the dog about sharing the sunny spot by the window.
meanings.sent4: The wise owl expostulates with the young birds about the importance of patience.
meanings.sent5: The mentor expostulates with the apprentice on the value of hard work.

meanings.sent1: The protestors expostulate against the new law outside the government building.
meanings.sent2: She expostulates with her brother about borrowing her clothes without asking.
meanings.sent3: The toddler expostulates with his toys when they don't stay stacked.
meanings.sent4: The thunder expostulates with the quiet night, shaking the windows with its power.
meanings.sent5: The storm clouds expostulate with the sky, rumbling their discontent.
